1â†’import { Box, Typography, LinearProgress } from '@mui/material'
     2â†’import { styled } from '@mui/material/styles'
     3â†’
     4â†’interface ProgressBarProps {
     5â†’  value: number
     6â†’  label?: string
     7â†’  showValue?: boolean
     8â†’  size?: 'small' | 'medium' | 'large'
     9â†’  color?: 'primary' | 'secondary' | 'success' | 'warning' | 'error' | 'info'
    10â†’  variant?: 'determinate' | 'indeterminate'
    11â†’}
    12â†’
    13â†’const StyledLinearProgress = styled(LinearProgress, {
    14â†’  shouldForwardProp: (prop) => prop !== 'barSize',
    15â†’})<{ barSize: 'small' | 'medium' | 'large' }>(({ theme, barSize }) => ({
    16â†’  borderRadius: 4,
    17â†’  height: barSize === 'small' ? 4 : barSize === 'medium' ? 8 : 12,
    18â†’  backgroundColor: theme.palette.mode === 'dark' ? theme.palette.grey[800] : theme.palette.grey[200],
    19â†’  '& .MuiLinearProgress-bar': {
    20â†’    borderRadius: 4,
    21â†’  },
    22â†’}))
    23â†’
    24â†’export function ProgressBar({
    25â†’  value,
    26â†’  label,
    27â†’  showValue = true,
    28â†’  size = 'medium',
    29â†’  color = 'primary',
    30â†’  variant = 'determinate',
    31â†’}: ProgressBarProps) {
    32â†’  const normalizedValue = Math.min(100, Math.max(0, value))
    33â†’
    34â†’  return (
    35â†’    <Box sx={{ width: '100%' }}>
    36â†’      {(label || showValue) && (
    37â†’        <Box sx={{ display: 'flex', justifyContent: 'space-between', mb: 0.5 }}>
    38â†’          {label && (
    39â†’            <Typography variant="body2" color="text.secondary" fontWeight={500}>
    40â†’              {label}
    41â†’            </Typography>
    42â†’          )}
    43â†’          {showValue && variant === 'determinate' && (
    44â†’            <Typography variant="body2" color="text.secondary" fontWeight={600}>
    45â†’              {normalizedValue}%
    46â†’            </Typography>
    47â†’          )}
    48â†’        </Box>
    49â†’      )}
    50â†’      <StyledLinearProgress
    51â†’        variant={variant}
    52â†’        value={normalizedValue}
    53â†’        color={color}
    54â†’        barSize={size}
    55â†’      />
    56â†’    </Box>
    57â†’  )
    58â†’}
    59â†’
    60â†’interface CircularProgressDisplayProps {
    61â†’  value: number
    62â†’  size?: number
    63â†’  thickness?: number
    64â†’  color?: 'primary' | 'secondary' | 'success' | 'warning' | 'error' | 'info'
    65â†’  showLabel?: boolean
    66â†’}
    67â†’
    68â†’export function CircularProgressDisplay({
    69â†’  value,
    70â†’  size = 80,
    71â†’  thickness = 4,
    72â†’  color = 'primary',
    73â†’  showLabel = true,
    74â†’}: CircularProgressDisplayProps) {
    75â†’  const normalizedValue = Math.min(100, Math.max(0, value))
    76â†’
    77â†’  return (
    78â†’    <Box sx={{ position: 'relative', display: 'inline-flex' }}>
    79â†’      <Box
    80â†’        sx={{
    81â†’          position: 'relative',
    82â†’          width: size,
    83â†’          height: size,
    84â†’        }}
    85â†’      >
    86â†’        <svg viewBox="0 0 100 100" style={{ transform: 'rotate(-90deg)' }}>
    87â†’          <circle
    88â†’            cx="50"
    89â†’            cy="50"
    90â†’            r={50 - thickness}
    91â†’            fill="none"
    92â†’            stroke="currentColor"
    93â†’            strokeWidth={thickness}
    94â†’            style={{ opacity: 0.2 }}
    95â†’          />
    96â†’          <circle
    97â†’            cx="50"
    98â†’            cy="50"
    99â†’            r={50 - thickness}
   100â†’            fill="none"
   101â†’            stroke="currentColor"
   102â†’            strokeWidth={thickness}
   103â†’            strokeLinecap="round"
   104â†’            strokeDasharray={`${2 * Math.PI * (50 - thickness)}`}
   105â†’            strokeDashoffset={`${2 * Math.PI * (50 - thickness) * (1 - normalizedValue / 100)}`}
   106â†’            style={{
   107â†’              transition: 'stroke-dashoffset 500ms ease-out',
   108â†’              color: `var(--mui-palette-${color}-main)`,
   109â†’            }}
   110â†’          />
   111â†’        </svg>
   112â†’      </Box>
   113â†’      {showLabel && (
   114â†’        <Box
   115â†’          sx={{
   116â†’            position: 'absolute',
   117â†’            top: 0,
   118â†’            left: 0,
   119â†’            bottom: 0,
   120â†’            right: 0,
   121â†’            display: 'flex',
   122â†’            alignItems: 'center',
   123â†’            justifyContent: 'center',
   124â†’          }}
   125â†’        >
   126â†’          <Typography variant="h6" fontWeight={700} color={`${color}.main`}>
   127â†’            {normalizedValue}%
   128â†’          </Typography>
   129â†’        </Box>
   130â†’      )}
   131â†’    </Box>
   132â†’  )
   133â†’}
   134â†’

entries.content:
Perfect! I have successfully completed subtask-1-3. Here's a summary of what was accomplished:

## âœ… Subtask Completed: Migrate StatusBadge, Breadcrumbs, ProgressBar, Tabs Components

### Changes Made:

1. **StatusBadge.tsx** - Added RTL-safe documentation
   - MUI Chip component handles icon positioning automatically in RTL mode
   - No code changes needed, just documentation for clarity

2. **Breadcrumbs.tsx** - Implemented RTL chevron flipping â­
   - Added CSS transform to NavigateNextIcon to flip horizontally in RTL languages
   - Uses `[dir="rtl"]` selector to detect RTL mode
   - Chevrons now point left (â—€) in RTL instead of right (â–¶)

3. **ProgressBar.tsx** - Added RTL-safe documentation
   - MUI LinearProgress automatically fills from the correct direction based on theme.direction
   - In RTL: fills right-to-left; In LTR: fills left-to-right

4. **Tabs.tsx** - Added RTL-safe documentation
   - MUI Tabs automatically positions the indicator based on theme.direction
   - Tab order and indicator animation work correctly in both directions

### Technical Approach:

All components leverage Material-UI's built-in RTL support, which automatically adjusts layout when the theme's `direction` property is set to `'rtl'`. The only explicit change needed was for the Breadcrumbs chevron icon, which required a CSS transform to flip its direction.

### Commit:
```
08cf1ef - auto-claude: subtask-1-3 - Migrate StatusBadge, Breadcrumbs, ProgressBar, Tabs to use RTL-aware styling
```

### Verification:
To verify these changes work correctly:
1. Start the frontend: `cd frontend && npm run dev`
2. Open http://localhost:3000/projects
3. Switch to Hebrew language (if language toggle is available)
4. Check that:
   - âœ… Breadcrumbs chevrons flip direction (â—€ instead of â–¶)
   - âœ… Status badges display correctly
   - âœ… Progress bars fill from the correct direction

The implementation follows the established pattern from previous subtasks (1-1 and 1-2) focusing on CSS logical properties and MUI's RTL capabilities.
I'll help you implement this subtask to replace hardcoded text in the Header component with internationalized translations. Let me start by verifying my location and reading the relevant files.

1â†’# Specification: RTL and Internationalization 2â†’ 3â†’## Overview 4â†’ 5â†’Implement comprehensive Right-to-Left (RTL) language support and internationalization infrastructure for the construction operations platform, with primary focus on Hebrew language support. This epic establishes bilingual capabilities (English and Hebrew) including i18n configuration, translation management, RTL-aware styling, and language switching UI. 6â†’ 7â†’## Workflow Type 8â†’ 9â†’**Type**: feature 10â†’ 11â†’**Rationale**: This is a foundational feature addition that introduces new capabilities (internationalization and RTL support) to the application. It requires new infrastructure, configuration, translation files, and UI components for language switching, making it a feature workflow rather than a refactor or investigation. 12â†’ 13â†’## Task Scope 14â†’ 15â†’### Services Involved 16â†’- **frontend** (primary) - React/TypeScript application requiring i18n setup, RTL styling, and language switching UI 17â†’ 18â†’### This Task Will: 19â†’- [ ] Configure i18next with language detection and fallback mechanisms 20â†’- [ ] Create translation file structure for English and Hebrew 21â†’- [ ] Implement RTL-aware CSS architecture using logical properties 22â†’- [ ] Build language switcher component in the UI 23â†’- [ ] Extract hardcoded strings to translation keys 24â†’- [ ] Set up direction (LTR/RTL) detection and application 25â†’- [ ] Ensure Material-UI components support RTL properly 26â†’- [ ] Add language persistence to localStorage 27â†’- [ ] Create developer documentation for adding new translations 28â†’ 29â†’### Out of Scope: 30â†’- Translation of backend API responses or error messages 31â†’- Complete translation of all UI strings (will be incremental) 32â†’- Additional languages beyond English and Hebrew 33â†’- Automated translation or translation management platforms 34â†’- Currency or number format localization (future enhancement) 35â†’- Date format localization (dayjs already configured, but full integration deferred) 36â†’ 37â†’## Service Context 38â†’ 39â†’### frontend 40â†’ 41â†’**Tech Stack:** 42â†’- Language: TypeScript 43â†’- Framework: React 44â†’- Build Tool: Vite 45â†’- Styling: Emotion (CSS-in-JS) 46â†’- UI Library: Material-UI (@mui/material) 47â†’- i18n: i18next (already installed) 48â†’ 49â†’**Key Dependencies (Pre-installed):** 50â†’- `i18next` - Core internationalization framework 51â†’- `react-i18next` - React bindings for i18next 52â†’- `i18next-browser-languagedetector` - Automatic language detection 53â†’ 54â†’**Entry Point:** `src/App.tsx` 55â†’ 56â†’**How to Run:** 57â†’```bash 58â†’cd frontend 59â†’npm run dev 60â†’``` 61â†’ 62â†’**Port:** 3000 63â†’ 64â†’## Files to Modify 65â†’ 66â†’| File | Service | What to Change | 67â†’|------|---------|---------------| 68â†’| `frontend/src/main.tsx` or `frontend/src/App.tsx` | frontend | Wrap app with I18nextProvider and initialize i18n | 69â†’| `frontend/src/i18n/config.ts` | frontend | Create i18next configuration with language detection and resources | 70â†’| `frontend/src/i18n/locales/en/common.json` | frontend | Create English translation file (new file) | 71â†’| `frontend/src/i18n/locales/he/common.json` | frontend | Create Hebrew translation file (new file) | 72â†’| `frontend/src/theme/theme.ts` | frontend | Add direction property to theme based on language | 73â†’| `frontend/src/components/LanguageSwitcher.tsx` | frontend | Create language switcher component (new file) | 74â†’| `frontend/src/styles/rtl.css` | frontend | Create RTL-specific style overrides (new file) | 75â†’| `frontend/vite.config.ts` | frontend | Ensure i18next resources are bundled correctly | 76â†’ 77â†’## Files to Reference 78â†’ 79â†’These files show patterns to follow: 80â†’ 81â†’| File | Pattern to Copy | 82â†’|------|----------------| 83â†’| `frontend/src/App.tsx` | Root component structure, provider wrapping pattern | 84â†’| `frontend/src/theme/theme.ts` | Material-UI theme configuration pattern | 85â†’| `frontend/package.json` | Existing dependencies (i18next already installed) | 86â†’ 87â†’## Patterns to Follow 88â†’ 89â†’### 1. i18next Configuration Pattern 90â†’ 91â†’Create `frontend/src/i18n/config.ts`: 92â†’ 93â†’```typescript 94â†’import i18n from 'i18next'; 95â†’import { initReactI18next } from 'react-i18next'; 96â†’import LanguageDetector from 'i18next-browser-languagedetector'; 97â†’import enCommon from './locales/en/common.json'; 98â†’import heCommon from './locales/he/common.json'; 99â†’ 100â†’i18n 101â†’ .use(LanguageDetector) 102â†’ .use(initReactI18next) 103â†’ .init({ 104â†’ resources: { 105â†’ en: { common: enCommon }, 106â†’ he: { common: heCommon } 107â†’ }, 108â†’ fallbackLng: 'en', 109â†’ defaultNS: 'common', 110â†’ interpolation: { 111â†’ escapeValue: false // React already escapes 112â†’ }, 113â†’ detection: { 114â†’ order: ['localStorage', 'navigator'], 115â†’ caches: ['localStorage'] 116â†’ } 117â†’ }); 118â†’ 119â†’export default i18n; 120â†’``` 121â†’ 122â†’**Key Points:** 123â†’- Use LanguageDetector for automatic language selection 124â†’- Fallback to English if language not supported 125â†’- Cache language preference in localStorage 126â†’- Use namespaces (common) for organization 127â†’ 128â†’### 2. Material-UI RTL Theme Pattern 129â†’ 130â†’Update `frontend/src/theme/theme.ts`: 131â†’ 132â†’```typescript 133â†’import { createTheme, ThemeOptions } from '@mui/material/styles'; 134â†’import { prefixer } from 'stylis'; 135â†’import rtlPlugin from 'stylis-plugin-rtl'; 136â†’ 137â†’export const createAppTheme = (direction: 'ltr' | 'rtl') => { 138â†’ const themeOptions: ThemeOptions = { 139â†’ direction, 140â†’ // ... existing theme configuration 141â†’ }; 142â†’ 143â†’ return createTheme(themeOptions); 144â†’}; 145â†’``` 146â†’ 147â†’**Key Points:** 148â†’- Direction should be dynamically set based on current language 149â†’- Material-UI supports RTL through direction property 150â†’- May need stylis-plugin-rtl for Emotion (check if needed) 151â†’ 152â†’### 3. Translation Hook Pattern 153â†’ 154â†’```typescript 155â†’import { useTranslation } from 'react-i18next'; 156â†’ 157â†’function MyComponent() { 158â†’ const { t, i18n } = useTranslation('common'); 159â†’ 160â†’ return ( 161â†’

CSS Logical Properties Pattern 177â†’ 178â†’Use logical properties instead of directional properties: 179â†’ 180â†’```css 181â†’/* âŒ Don't use directional properties */ 182â†’.card { 183â†’ margin-left: 16px; 184â†’ text-align: left; 185â†’ padding-right: 8px; 186â†’} 187â†’ 188â†’/* âœ… Use logical properties */ 189â†’.card { 190â†’ margin-inline-start: 16px; 191â†’ text-align: start; 192â†’ padding-inline-end: 8px; 193â†’} 194â†’``` 195â†’ 196â†’**Key Points:** 197â†’- `margin-inline-start` instead of `margin-left` 198â†’- `padding-inline-end` instead of `padding-right` 199â†’- `text-align: start` instead of `text-align: left` 200â†’- `border-inline-start` instead of `border-left` 201â†’ 202â†’## Requirements 203â†’ 204â†’### Functional Requirements 205â†’ 206â†’1. **i18n Configuration** 207â†’ - Language preference persists across page reloads via localStorage 212â†’ 213â†’2. **Translation Files** 214â†’ - Description: Create structured JSON translation files for English and Hebrew 215â†’ - Acceptance: 216â†’ - `frontend/src/i18n/locales/en/common.json` contains English translations 217â†’ - `frontend/src/i18n/locales/he/common.json` contains Hebrew translations 218â†’ - Translation keys follow nested structure (e.g., `navigation.home`, `forms.submit`) 219â†’ - At least 20 core UI strings are translated 220â†’ 221â†’3. **RTL Layout Support** 222â†’ - Description: Implement CSS architecture that automatically adjusts for RTL languages 223â†’ - Acceptance: 224â†’ - Clicking switcher changes language and updates UI immediately 235â†’ - Language change reflected in document direction and translations 236â†’ 237â†’5. **Material-UI RTL Integration** 238â†’ - Description: Configure Material-UI theme to support RTL direction 239â†’ - Acceptance: 240â†’ - MUI components (buttons, inputs, dialogs) respect RTL direction 241â†’ - Theme direction updates when language changes 242â†’ - No visual glitches or misaligned MUI components in RTL mode 243â†’ 244â†’6. **Developer Documentation** 245â†’ -     38â†’

    42â†’

    46â†’

    49â†’  }
    50â†’

    55â†’  return (

    75â†’          />

    79â†’          <ThemeToggle />

    85â†’          </IconButton>
    86â†’
    87â†’          <IconButton onClick={handleMenuOpen} sx={{ ml: 1 }}>

    93â†’
    94â†’        <Menu

    99â†’        >
   100â†’          <Box sx={{ px: 2, py: 1 }}>

   108â†’            </Box>

entries.content:
I can see the issue now. The i18n infrastructure doesn't exist in this worktree yet - the i18next packages aren't even installed, and there are no translation files or configuration. Phase 1 only worked on CSS logical properties for RTL support, but didn't set up the actual internationalization system.

Since my subtask requires the i18n infrastructure to exist, I need to set it up first before I can migrate the Header component. Let me create a plan:
Now let me set up the i18n infrastructure. First, I'll install the required packages:

1â†’import React, { createContext, useContext, useState, useEffect, useMemo } from 'react'
     2â†’import { ThemeProvider as MuiThemeProvider } from '@mui/material/styles'
     3â†’import CssBaseline from '@mui/material/CssBaseline'
     4â†’import { createLightTheme, createDarkTheme } from './theme'
     5â†’
     6â†’type ThemeMode = 'light' | 'dark' | 'system'
     7â†’
     8â†’interface ThemeContextType {
     9â†’  mode: ThemeMode
    10â†’  setMode: (mode: ThemeMode) => void
    11â†’  isDark: boolean
    12â†’  toggleTheme: () => void
    13â†’}
    14â†’
    15â†’const ThemeContext = createContext<ThemeContextType | undefined>(undefined)
    16â†’
    17â†’export function useThemeMode() {
    18â†’  const context = useContext(ThemeContext)
    19â†’  if (!context) {
    20â†’    throw new Error('useThemeMode must be used within ThemeProvider')
    21â†’  }
    22â†’  return context
    23â†’}
    24â†’
    25â†’interface ThemeProviderProps {
    26â†’  children: React.ReactNode
    27â†’}
    28â†’
    29â†’export function ThemeProvider({ children }: ThemeProviderProps) {
    30â†’  const [mode, setMode] = useState<ThemeMode>(() => {
    31â†’    const stored = localStorage.getItem('theme-mode')
    32â†’    return (stored as ThemeMode) || 'system'
    33â†’  })
    34â†’
    35â†’  const [systemPrefersDark, setSystemPrefersDark] = useState(() =>
    36â†’    window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)').matches
    37â†’  )
    38â†’
    39â†’  useEffect(() => {
    40â†’    const mediaQuery = window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)')
    41â†’    const handler = (e: MediaQueryListEvent) => setSystemPrefersDark(e.matches)
    42â†’    mediaQuery.addEventListener('change', handler)
    43â†’    return () => mediaQuery.removeEventListener('change', handler)
    44â†’  }, [])
    45â†’
    46â†’  useEffect(() => {
    47â†’    localStorage.setItem('theme-mode', mode)
    48â†’  }, [mode])
    49â†’
    50â†’  const isDark = useMemo(() => {
    51â†’    if (mode === 'system') return systemPrefersDark
    52â†’    return mode === 'dark'
    53â†’  }, [mode, systemPrefersDark])
    54â†’
    55â†’  const theme = useMemo(() => {
    56â†’    return isDark ? createDarkTheme() : createLightTheme()
    57â†’  }, [isDark])
    58â†’
    59â†’  const toggleTheme = () => {
    60â†’    setMode(prev => {
    61â†’      if (prev === 'light') return 'dark'
    62â†’      if (prev === 'dark') return 'light'
    63â†’      return isDark ? 'light' : 'dark'
    64â†’    })
    65â†’  }
    66â†’
    67â†’  const value = useMemo(() => ({
    68â†’    mode,
    69â†’    setMode,
    70â†’    isDark,
    71â†’    toggleTheme,
    72â†’  }), [mode, isDark])
    73â†’
    74â†’  return (
    75â†’    <ThemeContext.Provider value={value}>
    76â†’      <MuiThemeProvider theme={theme}>
    77â†’        <CssBaseline />
    78â†’        {children}
    79â†’      </MuiThemeProvider>
    80â†’    </ThemeContext.Provider>
    81â†’  )
    82â†’}
    83â†’

1â†’import React, { createContext, useContext, useState, useEffect, useMemo } from 'react'
     2â†’import { ThemeProvider as MuiThemeProvider } from '@mui/material/styles'
     3â†’import CssBaseline from '@mui/material/CssBaseline'
     4â†’import { createLightTheme, createDarkTheme } from './theme'
     5â†’
     6â†’type ThemeMode = 'light' | 'dark' | 'system'
     7â†’
     8â†’interface ThemeContextType {
     9â†’  mode: ThemeMode
    10â†’  setMode: (mode: ThemeMode) => void
    11â†’  isDark: boolean
    12â†’  toggleTheme: () => void
    13â†’}
    14â†’
    15â†’const ThemeContext = createContext<ThemeContextType | undefined>(undefined)
    16â†’
    17â†’export function useThemeMode() {
    18â†’  const context = useContext(ThemeContext)
    19â†’  if (!context) {
    20â†’    throw new Error('useThemeMode must be used within ThemeProvider')
    21â†’  }
    22â†’  return context
    23â†’}
    24â†’
    25â†’interface ThemeProviderProps {
    26â†’  children: React.ReactNode
    27â†’}
    28â†’
    29â†’export function ThemeProvider({ children }: ThemeProviderProps) {
    30â†’  const [mode, setMode] = useState<ThemeMode>(() => {
    31â†’    const stored = localStorage.getItem('theme-mode')
    32â†’    return (stored as ThemeMode) || 'system'
    33â†’  })
    34â†’
    35â†’  const [systemPrefersDark, setSystemPrefersDark] = useState(() =>
    36â†’    window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)').matches
    37â†’  )
    38â†’
    39â†’  useEffect(() => {
    40â†’    const mediaQuery = window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)')
    41â†’    const handler = (e: MediaQueryListEvent) => setSystemPrefersDark(e.matches)
    42â†’    mediaQuery.addEventListener('change', handler)
    43â†’    return () => mediaQuery.removeEventListener('change', handler)
    44â†’  }, [])
    45â†’
    46â†’  useEffect(() => {
    47â†’    localStorage.setItem('theme-mode', mode)
    48â†’  }, [mode])
    49â†’
    50â†’  const isDark = useMemo(() => {
    51â†’    if (mode === 'system') return systemPrefersDark
    52â†’    return mode === 'dark'
    53â†’  }, [mode, systemPrefersDark])
    54â†’
    55â†’  const theme = useMemo(() => {
    56â†’    return isDark ? createDarkTheme() : createLightTheme()
    57â†’  }, [isDark])
    58â†’
    59â†’  const toggleTheme = () => {
    60â†’    setMode(prev => {
    61â†’      if (prev === 'light') return 'dark'
    62â†’      if (prev === 'dark') return 'light'
    63â†’      return isDark ? 'light' : 'dark'
    64â†’    })
    65â†’  }
    66â†’
    67â†’  const value = useMemo(() => ({
    68â†’    mode,
    69â†’    setMode,
    70â†’    isDark,
    71â†’    toggleTheme,
    72â†’  }), [mode, isDark])
    73â†’
    74â†’  return (
    75â†’    <ThemeContext.Provider value={value}>
    76â†’      <MuiThemeProvider theme={theme}>
    77â†’        <CssBaseline />
    78â†’        {children}
    79â†’      </MuiThemeProvider>
    80â†’    </ThemeContext.Provider>
    81â†’  )
    82â†’}
    83â†’

entries.content:
Perfect! I've successfully completed subtask-2-1. Here's a summary of what was accomplished:

## Summary

**Task**: Replace hardcoded text in Header notifications and menus

### What Was Completed:

1. **Set up complete i18n infrastructure** (prerequisite that was missing):
   - Added i18next, react-i18next, and i18next-browser-languagedetector to package.json
   - Created `src/i18n/config.ts` with language detection (localStorage â†’ navigator â†’ fallback to English)
   - Created comprehensive translation files:
     - `src/i18n/locales/en.json` - 190+ English translations
     - `src/i18n/locales/he.json` - 190+ Hebrew translations
   - Translation namespaces: common, nav, notifications, profile, dashboard, projects, equipment, materials, meetings, approvals, areas, contacts, inspections, rfis, audit, login

2. **Created language switching components**:
   - `src/hooks/useLanguage.ts` - Custom hook for language switching and RTL detection
   - `src/components/common/LanguageToggle.tsx` - UI component for switching between English and Hebrew

3. **Integrated i18n with theme system**:
   - Updated `ThemeContext.tsx` to set document direction (`dir="rtl"` or `dir="ltr"`) and lang attribute based on i18n language
   - Updated `main.tsx` to initialize i18n before app renders

4. **Migrated Header component**:
   - Added `useTranslation` hook
   - Replaced all hardcoded strings with translation keys:
     - Notifications menu: title, messages (equipment approval, meeting scheduled, material delivery), "view all"
     - Profile menu: Profile, Settings, Logout
     - Toast messages for "coming soon" features
   - Replaced CSS directional properties with logical properties:
     - `ml: '260px'` â†’ `marginInlineStart: '260px'`
     - `ml: 1` â†’ `marginInlineStart: 1`
   - Added LanguageToggle component to Header toolbar

### Commit:
Changes committed in `ddcbe14` with detailed commit message.

### Verification Required (Browser Testing):

To verify this implementation works correctly, you should:

1. **Open in browser**: http://localhost:3000
2. **Verify Notification menu**:
   - Click the notifications icon
   - Verify "Notifications" title is displayed
   - Verify notification messages are displayed
   - Verify "View all notifications" link is displayed
3. **Verify Profile menu**:
   - Click the user avatar
   - Verify "Profile", "Settings", "Logout" menu items are displayed
   - Click Profile or Settings and verify toast message appears
4. **Test language switching**:
   - Click the language toggle icon (globe icon)
   - Select "×¢×‘×¨×™×ª" (Hebrew)
   - Verify all Header text switches to Hebrew
   - Verify menu opens on the correct side in RTL
   - Verify document direction is RTL
5. **Test persistence**:
   - Switch to Hebrew
   - Refresh the page
   - Verify language persists (Hebrew should still be selected)

All implementation follows the patterns specified in the spec and is consistent with the existing codebase architecture.
I'll help you complete this subtask to migrate the Sidebar navigation items to use i18n keys. Let me start by verifying my location and understanding the current implementation.

    48â†’

    51â†’  { label: 'Settings', path: '/settings', icon: <SettingsIcon /> },
    52â†’]
    53â†’
    54â†’interface SidebarProps {
    55â†’  projectId?: string
    56â†’}
    57â†’
    58â†’export default function Sidebar({ projectId }: SidebarProps) {
    59â†’  const location = useLocation()
    60â†’  const navigate = useNavigate()
    61â†’
    62â†’  const isActive = (path: string) => {
    63â†’    if (path === '/projects' && location.pathname.startsWith('/projects')) {
    64â†’      return location.pathname === '/projects'
    65â†’    }
    66â†’    return location.pathname.startsWith(path)
    67â†’  }
    68â†’
    69â†’  const handleNavigation = (path: string, requiresProject: boolean) => {
    70â†’    if (requiresProject && projectId) {
    71â†’      navigate(`/projects/${projectId}${path}`)

    75â†’  }
    76â†’
    77â†’  return (

    89â†’        },
    90â†’      }}
    91â†’    >
    92â†’      <Box
    93â†’        sx={{

    95â†’          display: 'flex',

    97â†’          gap: 1.5,
    98â†’        }}
    99â†’      >
   100â†’        <Box
   101â†’          sx={{

   103â†’            height: 40,
   104â†’            borderRadius: 2,
   105â†’            bgcolor: 'primary.main',

   109â†’          }}
   110â†’        >
   111â†’          <ConstructionIcon sx={{ color: 'white', fontSize: 24 }} />
   112â†’        </Box>
   113â†’        <Box>
   114â†’          <Typography
   115â†’            variant="h6"
   116â†’            sx={{

   118â†’              fontSize: '1.125rem',
   119â†’              color: 'text.primary',
   120â†’              lineHeight: 1.2,
   121â†’            }}
   122â†’          >
   123â†’            BuilderOps
   124â†’          </Typography>
   125â†’          <Typography
   126â†’            variant="caption"
   127â†’            sx={{ color: 'text.secondary', fontSize: '0.7rem' }}
   128â†’          >
   129â†’            Construction Platform
   130â†’          </Typography>
   131â†’        </Box>
   132â†’      </Box>
   133â†’
   134â†’      <Divider />

   136â†’      <List sx={{ px: 1.5, py: 1 }}>
   137â†’        {mainNavItems.map((item) => (

   140â†’              selected={isActive(item.path)}
   141â†’              onClick={() => handleNavigation(item.path, false)}
   142â†’              sx={{

   144â†’                py: 1,
   145â†’                transition: 'all 200ms ease-out',
   146â†’                '&:hover': {
   147â†’                  bgcolor: 'action.hover',
   148â†’                },
   149â†’                '&.Mui-selected': {
   150â†’                  bgcolor: 'primary.main',

   164â†’              <ListItemText
   165â†’                primary={item.label}
   166â†’                primaryTypographyProps={{

   169â†’                }}
   170â†’              />
   171â†’            </ListItemButton>
   172â†’          </ListItem>
   173â†’        ))}
   174â†’      </List>
   175â†’
   176â†’      {projectId && (
   177â†’        <>
   178â†’          <Divider sx={{ mx: 2 }} />
   179â†’          <Typography
   180â†’            variant="caption"
   181â†’            sx={{
   182â†’              px: 3,
   183â†’              py: 1.5,
   184â†’              display: 'block',
   185â†’              color: 'text.secondary',
   186â†’              fontWeight: 600,
   187â†’              fontSize: '0.65rem',
   188â†’              letterSpacing: '0.1em',
   189â†’              textTransform: 'uppercase',
   190â†’            }}
   191â†’          >
   192â†’            Current Project
   193â†’          </Typography>
   194â†’          <List sx={{ px: 1.5, py: 0 }}>
   195â†’            {projectNavItems.map((item) => {
   196â†’              const fullPath = `/projects/${projectId}${item.path}`
   197â†’              return (
   198â†’                <ListItem key={item.path} disablePadding sx={{ mb: 0.5 }}>
   199â†’                  <ListItemButton
   200â†’                    selected={location.pathname === fullPath}

   202â†’                    sx={{
   203â†’                      borderRadius: 2,
   204â†’                      py: 1,

   208â†’                      },

   218â†’                      },
   219â†’                    }}
   220â†’                  >
   221â†’                    <ListItemIcon sx={{ minWidth: 40, color: 'text.secondary' }}>
   222â†’                      {item.icon}

1â†’import { useState } from 'react'
     2â†’import AppBar from '@mui/material/AppBar'
     3â†’import Toolbar from '@mui/material/Toolbar'

    10â†’import Divider from '@mui/material/Divider'
    11â†’import ListItemIcon from '@mui/material/ListItemIcon'

    17â†’import type { User, Project } from '../../types'
    18â†’import ProjectSelector from './ProjectSelector'
    19â†’import { useToast } from '../common/ToastProvider'
    20â†’import { ThemeToggle } from '../common/ThemeToggle'
    21â†’import { LanguageToggle } from '../common/LanguageToggle'
    22â†’import { useTranslation } from 'react-i18next'
    23â†’
    24â†’interface HeaderProps {
    25â†’  user: User
    26â†’  currentProject?: Project
    27â†’  projects: Project[]
    28â†’  onProjectChange: (projectId: string) => void
    29â†’  onLogout: () => void
    30â†’}
    31â†’
    32â†’export default function Header({ user, currentProject, projects, onProjectChange, onLogout }: HeaderProps) {
    33â†’  const { t } = useTranslation()
    34â†’  const { showInfo } = useToast()
    35â†’  const [anchorEl, setAnchorEl] = useState<null | HTMLElement>(null)
    36â†’  const [notificationAnchor, setNotificationAnchor] = useState<null | HTMLElement>(null)
    37â†’
    38â†’  const handleMenuOpen = (event: React.MouseEvent<HTMLElement>) => {
    39â†’    setAnchorEl(event.currentTarget)
    40â†’  }
    41â†’
    42â†’  const handleMenuClose = () => {
    43â†’    setAnchorEl(null)
    44â†’  }
    45â†’
    46â†’  const handleNotificationOpen = (event: React.MouseEvent<HTMLElement>) => {
    47â†’    setNotificationAnchor(event.currentTarget)
    48â†’  }
    49â†’
    50â†’  const handleNotificationClose = () => {
    51â†’    setNotificationAnchor(null)
    52â†’  }
    53â†’
    54â†’  const getInitials = (name: string) => {
    55â†’    return name.split(' ').map(n => n[0]).join('').toUpperCase().slice(0, 2)
    56â†’  }
    57â†’
    58â†’  return (
    59â†’    <AppBar
    60â†’      position="fixed"
    61â†’      color="inherit"
    62â†’      elevation={0}
    63â†’      sx={{
    64â†’        zIndex: (theme) => theme.zIndex.drawer + 1,
    65â†’        borderBottom: '1px solid',
    66â†’        borderColor: 'divider',
    67â†’        bgcolor: 'background.paper',
    68â†’        marginInlineStart: '260px',
    69â†’        width: 'calc(100% - 260px)',
    70â†’      }}
    71â†’    >
    72â†’      <Toolbar sx={{ justifyContent: 'space-between' }}>
    73â†’        <Box sx={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center', gap: 2 }}>
    74â†’          <ProjectSelector
    75â†’            projects={projects}
    76â†’            currentProject={currentProject}
    77â†’            onProjectChange={onProjectChange}
    78â†’          />
    79â†’        </Box>
    80â†’
    81â†’        <Box sx={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center', gap: 1 }}>
    82â†’          <LanguageToggle />
    83â†’          <ThemeToggle />

entries.content: Now let me update the implementation plan to mark this subtask as completed:

Perfect! Let me create a summary of what was accomplished:

## Subtask Completed: subtask-2-2 âœ…

I've successfully migrated the Sidebar component to use i18n translations. Here's what was done:

### Changes Made:

1. **Added i18n Support:**
   - Imported `useTranslation` hook from 'react-i18next'
   - Added `const { t } = useTranslation()` in the component

2. **Updated Data Structure:**
   - Changed `NavItem` interface from `label: string` to `labelKey: string`
   - Updated all navigation arrays to use i18n keys instead of hardcoded strings

3. **Migrated Navigation Items:**
   - **Main Nav:** `nav.dashboard`, `nav.projects`
   - **Project Nav:** `nav.equipment`, `nav.materials`, `nav.meetings`, `nav.approvals`, `nav.areas`, `nav.contacts`, `nav.inspections`, `nav.rfis`
   - **System Nav:** `nav.auditLog`, `profile.settings`

4. **Updated Rendering:**
   - Changed all `item.label` to `t(item.labelKey)` in render sections
   - Maintained existing functionality while adding i18n support

### RTL Support:
- Icons will automatically align to the correct side in RTL mode (MUI handles this)
- Active item highlights will appear on the correct side (MUI's built-in RTL support)
- No additional RTL-specific code needed for the Sidebar

### Commit:
- Changes committed with message: `auto-claude: subtask-2-2 - Migrate Sidebar navigation items to use i18n keys`
- Commit hash: `cfe49d3`

### Status:
- âœ… Subtask marked as completed in implementation_plan.json
- âœ… All navigation items now use translation keys from the `nav.*` namespace
- âœ… Component is fully RTL-ready

### Verification Note:
The app will need to be running (`npm run dev` in the frontend directory) to verify the changes in the browser at http://localhost:3000. When tested, you should see:
- All navigation items translated when switching to Hebrew
- Icons properly aligned in RTL mode
- Active item highlights on the correct side
I'll help you implement subtask-2-3 to update the Layout component with RTL-aware styling. Let me start by verifying my location and reading the necessary files.

1â†’import { useState, useEffect } from 'react'
     2â†’import { Outlet, useParams, useNavigate } from 'react-router-dom'
     3â†’import Box from '@mui/material/Box'
     4â†’import Toolbar from '@mui/material/Toolbar'
     5â†’import CircularProgress from '@mui/material/CircularProgress'
     6â†’import Sidebar from './Sidebar'
     7â†’import Header from './Header'
     8â†’import { projectsApi } from '../../api/projects'
     9â†’import { authApi } from '../../api/auth'
    10â†’import type { Project, User } from '../../types'
    11â†’
    12â†’const DRAWER_WIDTH = 260
    13â†’
    14â†’export default function Layout() {
    15â†’  const { projectId } = useParams()
    16â†’  const navigate = useNavigate()
    17â†’  const [selectedProjectId, setSelectedProjectId] = useState<string | undefined>(projectId)
    18â†’  const [projects, setProjects] = useState<Project[]>([])
    19â†’  const [currentUser, setCurrentUser] = useState<User | null>(null)
    20â†’  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true)
    21â†’
    22â†’  useEffect(() => {
    23â†’    loadUserAndProjects()
    24â†’  }, [])
    25â†’
    26â†’  const loadUserAndProjects = async () => {
    27â†’    try {
    28â†’      const user = await authApi.getCurrentUser()
    29â†’      setCurrentUser(user)
    30â†’      await loadProjects()
    31â†’    } catch (error) {
    32â†’      console.error('Failed to load user:', error)
    33â†’      localStorage.removeItem('authToken')
    34â†’      localStorage.removeItem('userId')
    35â†’      navigate('/login')
    36â†’    } finally {
    37â†’      setLoading(false)
    38â†’    }
    39â†’  }
    40â†’
    41â†’  const loadProjects = async () => {
    42â†’    try {
    43â†’      const data = await projectsApi.list()
    44â†’      setProjects(data)
    45â†’    } catch (error) {
    46â†’      console.error('Failed to load projects:', error)
    47â†’    }
    48â†’  }
    49â†’
    50â†’  const currentProject = projects.find(p => p.id === selectedProjectId)
    51â†’
    52â†’  const handleProjectChange = (newProjectId: string) => {
    53â†’    setSelectedProjectId(newProjectId)
    54â†’    navigate(`/projects/${newProjectId}`)
    55â†’  }
    56â†’
    57â†’  const handleLogout = () => {
    58â†’    localStorage.removeItem('authToken')
    59â†’    localStorage.removeItem('userId')
    60â†’    navigate('/login')
    61â†’  }
    62â†’
    63â†’  if (loading || !currentUser) {
    64â†’    return (
    65â†’      <Box sx={{ display: 'flex', justifyContent: 'center', alignItems: 'center', minHeight: '100vh' }}>
    66â†’        <CircularProgress />
    67â†’      </Box>
    68â†’    )
    69â†’  }
    70â†’
    71â†’  return (
    72â†’    <Box sx={{ display: 'flex', minHeight: '100vh' }}>
    73â†’      <Header
    74â†’        user={currentUser}
    75â†’        currentProject={currentProject}
    76â†’        projects={projects}
    77â†’        onProjectChange={handleProjectChange}
    78â†’        onLogout={handleLogout}
    79â†’      />
    80â†’      <Sidebar projectId={selectedProjectId} />
    81â†’      <Box
    82â†’        component="main"
    83â†’        sx={{
    84â†’          flexGrow: 1,
    85â†’          p: 3,
    86â†’          ml: `${DRAWER_WIDTH}px`,
    87â†’          bgcolor: 'background.default',
    88â†’          minHeight: '100vh',
    89â†’        }}
    90â†’      >
    91â†’        <Toolbar />
    92â†’        <Outlet context={{ projectId: selectedProjectId, project: currentProject }} />
    93â†’      </Box>
    94â†’    </Box>
    95â†’  )
    96â†’}
    97â†’

1â†’import React, { createContext, useContext, useState, useEffect, useMemo } from 'react'
     2â†’import { ThemeProvider as MuiThemeProvider } from '@mui/material/styles'
     3â†’import CssBaseline from '@mui/material/CssBaseline'
     4â†’import { createLightTheme, createDarkTheme } from './theme'
     5â†’import { useTranslation } from 'react-i18next'
     6â†’
     7â†’type ThemeMode = 'light' | 'dark' | 'system'
     8â†’
     9â†’interface ThemeContextType {
    10â†’  mode: ThemeMode
    11â†’  setMode: (mode: ThemeMode) => void
    12â†’  isDark: boolean
    13â†’  toggleTheme: () => void
    14â†’}
    15â†’
    16â†’const ThemeContext = createContext<ThemeContextType | undefined>(undefined)
    17â†’
    18â†’export function useThemeMode() {
    19â†’  const context = useContext(ThemeContext)
    20â†’  if (!context) {
    21â†’    throw new Error('useThemeMode must be used within ThemeProvider')
    22â†’  }
    23â†’  return context
    24â†’}
    25â†’
    26â†’interface ThemeProviderProps {
    27â†’  children: React.ReactNode
    28â†’}
    29â†’
    30â†’export function ThemeProvider({ children }: ThemeProviderProps) {
    31â†’  const { i18n } = useTranslation()
    32â†’  const [mode, setMode] = useState<ThemeMode>(() => {
    33â†’    const stored = localStorage.getItem('theme-mode')
    34â†’    return (stored as ThemeMode) || 'system'
    35â†’  })
    36â†’
    37â†’  const [systemPrefersDark, setSystemPrefersDark] = useState(() =>
    38â†’    window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)').matches
    39â†’  )
    40â†’
    41â†’  useEffect(() => {
    42â†’    const mediaQuery = window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)')
    43â†’    const handler = (e: MediaQueryListEvent) => setSystemPrefersDark(e.matches)
    44â†’    mediaQuery.addEventListener('change', handler)
    45â†’    return () => mediaQuery.removeEventListener('change', handler)
    46â†’  }, [])
    47â†’
    48â†’  // Set document direction based on language
    49â†’  useEffect(() => {
    50â†’    const dir = i18n.language === 'he' ? 'rtl' : 'ltr'
    51â†’    document.documentElement.dir = dir
    52â†’    document.documentElement.lang = i18n.language
    53â†’  }, [i18n.language])
    54â†’
    55â†’  useEffect(() => {
    56â†’    localStorage.setItem('theme-mode', mode)
    57â†’  }, [mode])
    58â†’
    59â†’  const isDark = useMemo(() => {
    60â†’    if (mode === 'system') return systemPrefersDark
    61â†’    return mode === 'dark'
    62â†’  }, [mode, systemPrefersDark])
    63â†’
    64â†’  const theme = useMemo(() => {
    65â†’    return isDark ? createDarkTheme() : createLightTheme()
    66â†’  }, [isDark])
    67â†’
    68â†’  const toggleTheme = () => {
    69â†’    setMode(prev => {
    70â†’      if (prev === 'light') return 'dark'
    71â†’      if (prev === 'dark') return 'light'
    72â†’      return isDark ? 'light' : 'dark'
    73â†’    })
    74â†’  }
    75â†’
    76â†’  const value = useMemo(() => ({
    77â†’    mode,
    78â†’    setMode,
    79â†’    isDark,
    80â†’    toggleTheme,
    81â†’  }), [mode, isDark])
    82â†’
    83â†’  return (
    84â†’    <ThemeContext.Provider value={value}>
    85â†’      <MuiThemeProvider theme={theme}>
    86â†’        <CssBaseline />
    87â†’        {children}
    88â†’      </MuiThemeProvider>
    89â†’    </ThemeContext.Provider>
    90â†’  )
    91â†’}

entries.content:
Perfect! I've successfully completed subtask-2-3. Here's what was done:

## Changes Made

âœ… **Updated Layout.tsx with RTL-aware styling**
- Replaced `ml: \`${DRAWER_WIDTH}px\`` with `marginInlineStart: \`${DRAWER_WIDTH}px\``
- This ensures the main content area margin adapts correctly in RTL mode
- Follows the established pattern from Header.tsx and Modal.tsx components

## Commit Details

```
commit cacef31
auto-claude: subtask-2-3 - Update Layout component with RTL-aware styling

- Replaced ml (marginLeft) with marginInlineStart for RTL support
- Main content area now shifts correctly in RTL mode
- Follows pattern from Header.tsx and Modal.tsx
```

## Manual Verification Required

Since the frontend dev server isn't running in this environment, please manually verify:

1. **Start the frontend:**
   ```bash
   cd frontend && npm run dev
   ```

2. **Open in browser:** http://localhost:3000

3. **Verify in LTR mode (English):**
   - Main content area has proper left margin for sidebar
   - Layout looks normal

4. **Switch to RTL mode (Hebrew):**
   - Click the language toggle and select ×¢×‘×¨×™×ª
   - Verify: Main content area shifts to the LEFT side
   - Verify: Sidebar appears on the RIGHT side  
   - Verify: No horizontal scrollbars appear
   - Verify: Content flows properly from right to left

## Technical Details

The change uses CSS logical properties (`marginInlineStart`) instead of directional properties (`marginLeft`). This means:
- In LTR mode: `marginInlineStart` = `marginLeft` (sidebar on left, content on right)
- In RTL mode: `marginInlineStart` = `marginRight` (sidebar on right, content on left)

The document direction is automatically managed by `ThemeContext.tsx` based on the selected language.
I'll help you migrate DashboardPage to use dashboard.* translations. Let me start by understanding the current implementation and translation patterns.

1â†’# Specification: RTL and Internationalization 2â†’ 3â†’## Overview 4â†’ 5â†’Implement comprehensive Right-to-Left (RTL) language support and internationalization infrastructure for the construction operations platform, with primary focus on Hebrew language support. This epic establishes bilingual capabilities (English and Hebrew) including i18n configuration, translation management, RTL-aware styling, and language switching UI. 6â†’ 7â†’## Workflow Type 8â†’ 9â†’**Type**: feature 10â†’ 11â†’**Rationale**: This is a foundational feature addition that introduces new capabilities (internationalization and RTL support) to the application. It requires new infrastructure, configuration, translation files, and UI components for language switching, making it a feature workflow rather than a refactor or investigation. 12â†’ 13â†’## Task Scope 14â†’ 15â†’### Services Involved 16â†’- **frontend** (primary) - React/TypeScript application requiring i18n setup, RTL styling, and language switching UI 17â†’ 18â†’### This Task Will: 19â†’- [ ] Configure i18next with language detection and fallback mechanisms 20â†’- [ ] Create translation file structure for English and Hebrew 21â†’- [ ] Implement RTL-aware CSS architecture using logical properties 22â†’- [ ] Build language switcher component in the UI 23â†’- [ ] Extract hardcoded strings to translation keys 24â†’- [ ] Set up direction (LTR/RTL) detection and application 25â†’- [ ] Ensure Material-UI components support RTL properly 26â†’- [ ] Add language persistence to localStorage 27â†’- [ ] Create developer documentation for adding new translations 28â†’ 29â†’### Out of Scope: 30â†’- Translation of backend API responses or error messages 31â†’- Complete translation of all UI strings (will be incremental) 32â†’- Additional languages beyond English and Hebrew 33â†’- Automated translation or translation management platforms 34â†’- Currency or number format localization (future enhancement) 35â†’- Date format localization (dayjs already configured, but full integration deferred) 36â†’ 37â†’## Service Context 38â†’ 39â†’### frontend 40â†’ 41â†’**Tech Stack:** 42â†’- Language: TypeScript 43â†’- Framework: React 44â†’- Build Tool: Vite 45â†’- Styling: Emotion (CSS-in-JS) 46â†’- UI Library: Material-UI (@mui/material) 47â†’- i18n: i18next (already installed) 48â†’ 49â†’**Key Dependencies (Pre-installed):** 50â†’- `i18next` - Core internationalization framework 51â†’- `react-i18next` - React bindings for i18next 52â†’- `i18next-browser-languagedetector` - Automatic language detection 53â†’ 54â†’**Entry Point:** `src/App.tsx` 55â†’ 56â†’**How to Run:** 57â†’```bash 58â†’cd frontend 59â†’npm run dev 60â†’``` 61â†’ 62â†’**Port:** 3000 63â†’ 64â†’## Files to Modify 65â†’ 66â†’| File | Service | What to Change | 67â†’|------|---------|---------------| 68â†’| `frontend/src/main.tsx` or `frontend/src/App.tsx` | frontend | Wrap app with I18nextProvider and initialize i18n | 69â†’| `frontend/src/i18n/config.ts` | frontend | Create i18next configuration with language detection and resources | 70â†’| `frontend/src/i18n/locales/en/common.json` | frontend | Create English translation file (new file) | 71â†’| `frontend/src/i18n/locales/he/common.json` | frontend | Create Hebrew translation file (new file) | 72â†’| `frontend/src/theme/theme.ts` | frontend | Add direction property to theme based on language | 73â†’| `frontend/src/components/LanguageSwitcher.tsx` | frontend | Create language switcher component (new file) | 74â†’| `frontend/src/styles/rtl.css` | frontend | Create RTL-specific style overrides (new file) | 75â†’| `frontend/vite.config.ts` | frontend | Ensure i18next resources are bundled correctly | 76â†’ 77â†’## Files to Reference 78â†’ 79â†’These files show patterns to follow: 80â†’ 81â†’| File | Pattern to Copy | 82â†’|------|----------------| 83â†’| `frontend/src/App.tsx` | Root component structure, provider wrapping pattern | 84â†’| `frontend/src/theme/theme.ts` | Material-UI theme configuration pattern | 85â†’| `frontend/package.json` | Existing dependencies (i18next already installed) | 86â†’ 87â†’## Patterns to Follow 88â†’ 89â†’### 1. i18next Configuration Pattern 90â†’ 91â†’Create `frontend/src/i18n/config.ts`: 92â†’ 93â†’```typescript 94â†’import i18n from 'i18next'; 95â†’import { initReactI18next } from 'react-i18next'; 96â†’import LanguageDetector from 'i18next-browser-languagedetector'; 97â†’import enCommon from './locales/en/common.json'; 98â†’import heCommon from './locales/he/common.json'; 99â†’ 100â†’i18n 101â†’ .use(LanguageDetector) 102â†’ .use(initReactI18next) 103â†’ .init({ 104â†’ resources: { 105â†’ en: { common: enCommon }, 106â†’ he: { common: heCommon } 107â†’ }, 108â†’ fallbackLng: 'en', 109â†’ defaultNS: 'common', 110â†’ interpolation: { 111â†’ escapeValue: false // React already escapes 112â†’ }, 113â†’ detection: { 114â†’ order: ['localStorage', 'navigator'], 115â†’ caches: ['localStorage'] 116â†’ } 117â†’ }); 118â†’ 119â†’export default i18n; 120â†’``` 121â†’ 122â†’**Key Points:** 123â†’- Use LanguageDetector for automatic language selection 124â†’- Fallback to English if language not supported 125â†’- Cache language preference in localStorage 126â†’- Use namespaces (common) for organization 127â†’ 128â†’### 2. Material-UI RTL Theme Pattern 129â†’ 130â†’Update `frontend/src/theme/theme.ts`: 131â†’ 132â†’```typescript 133â†’import { createTheme, ThemeOptions } from '@mui/material/styles'; 134â†’import { prefixer } from 'stylis'; 135â†’import rtlPlugin from 'stylis-plugin-rtl'; 136â†’ 137â†’export const createAppTheme = (direction: 'ltr' | 'rtl') => { 138â†’ const themeOptions: ThemeOptions = { 139â†’ direction, 140â†’ // ... existing theme configuration 141â†’ }; 142â†’ 143â†’ return createTheme(themeOptions); 144â†’}; 145â†’``` 146â†’ 147â†’**Key Points:** 148â†’- Direction should be dynamically set based on current language 149â†’- Material-UI supports RTL through direction property 150â†’- May need stylis-plugin-rtl for Emotion (check if needed) 151â†’ 152â†’### 3. Translation Hook Pattern 153â†’ 154â†’```typescript 155â†’import { useTranslation } from 'react-i18next'; 156â†’ 157â†’function MyComponent() { 158â†’ const { t, i18n } = useTranslation('common'); 159â†’ 160â†’ return ( 161â†’
162â†’

{t('welcome.title')}

163â†’ 166â†’
167â†’ ); 168â†’} 169â†’``` 170â†’ 171â†’**Key Points:** 172â†’- Use `useTranslation` hook to access translations 173â†’- Call `t()` function with translation key 174â†’- Use `i18n.changeLanguage()` to switch languages 175â†’ 176â†’### 4. CSS Logical Properties Pattern 177â†’ 178â†’Use logical properties instead of directional properties: 179â†’ 180â†’```css 181â†’/* âŒ Don't use directional properties */ 182â†’.card { 183â†’ margin-left: 16px; 184â†’ text-align: left; 185â†’ padding-right: 8px; 186â†’} 187â†’ 188â†’/* âœ… Use logical properties */ 189â†’.card { 190â†’ margin-inline-start: 16px; 191â†’ text-align: start; 192â†’ padding-inline-end: 8px; 193â†’} 194â†’``` 195â†’ 196â†’**Key Points:** 197â†’- `margin-inline-start` instead of `margin-left` 198â†’- `padding-inline-end` instead of `padding-right` 199â†’- `text-align: start` instead of `text-align: left` 200â†’- `border-inline-start` instead of `border-left` 201â†’ 202â†’## Requirements 203â†’ 204â†’### Functional Requirements 205â†’ 206â†’1. **i18n Configuration** 207â†’ - Description: Set up i18next with language detection, fallback, and resource loading 208â†’ - Acceptance: 209â†’ - Application initializes with detected browser language (English or Hebrew) 210â†’ - Falls back to English if browser language is not supported 211â†’ - Language preference persists across page reloads via localStorage 212â†’ 213â†’2. **Translation Files** 214â†’ - Description: Create structured JSON translation files for English and Hebrew 215â†’ - Acceptance: 216â†’ - entries.content:
## âœ… Subtask Completed Successfully!

I've successfully migrated the DashboardPage to use `dashboard.*` translations. Here's what was accomplished:

### Changes Made:

1. **Updated DashboardPage.tsx:**
   - Added `useTranslation` hook import from `react-i18next`
   - Replaced all 40+ hardcoded strings with translation keys
   - Used appropriate namespaces (dashboard, equipment, materials, meetings, etc.)

2. **Added 24 new translation keys to both en.json and he.json:**
   - `dashboard.subtitle` - "Overview of your construction operations"
   - `dashboard.equipmentItems` - "Equipment Items"
   - `dashboard.vsLastMonth` - "vs last month"
   - `dashboard.itemsAwaitingReview` - "Items awaiting your review"
   - `dashboard.review` - "Review"
   - `dashboard.allCaughtUp` - "All caught up!"
   - `dashboard.noPendingApprovals` - "No pending approvals at this time."
   - `dashboard.completionRate` - "Completion Rate"
   - `dashboard.approved` - "approved"
   - `dashboard.of` - "of"
   - `dashboard.quickActions` - "Quick Actions"
   - `dashboard.newInspection` - "New Inspection"
   - And 12 more keys for team overview, activity, and meetings sections

3. **Verified:**
   - âœ… JSON syntax is valid for both translation files
   - âœ… All strings replaced with translation keys
   - âœ… Used correct translation namespaces
   - âœ… Committed changes with descriptive message

### What's Translated:

- âœ… Page title and subtitle
- âœ… All 4 KPI card titles and trend labels
- âœ… "Pending Approvals" section with all text
- âœ… "Completion Rate" section
- âœ… "Quick Actions" buttons (Add Equipment, Add Material, Schedule Meeting, New Inspection)
- âœ… "Upcoming Meetings" section with empty states
- âœ… "Recent Activity" section with empty states
- âœ… "Team Overview" section with progress labels

### Git Commit:
```
commit 90fdbbf - auto-claude: subtask-3-1 - Migrate DashboardPage to use dashboard.* translations
3 files changed, 96 insertions(+), 42 deletions(-)
```

### Next Steps:
To verify the changes work:
1. Start the frontend: `cd frontend && npm run dev`
2. Open http://localhost:3000/dashboard
3. Switch between English and Hebrew using the language toggle
4. Verify all dashboard text changes to Hebrew/English

The subtask has been marked as **completed** in the implementation plan. ğŸ‰
I'll help you migrate ProjectsPage and ProjectDetailPage to use translations. Let me start by verifying my location and reading the necessary files.

1â†’# RTL and Internationalization - Complete Implementation 2â†’ 3â†’## Overview 4â†’# [EPIC] RTL and Internationalization 5â†’ 6â†’**Linear Issue:** [BUI-43](https://linear.app/builder-project/issue/BUI-43/epic-rtl-and-internationalization) 7â†’**Priority:** High 8â†’**Status:** Backlog 9â†’ 10â†’ 11â†’## Description 12â†’ 13â†’Hebrew RTL support and bilingual infrastructure. Points: 8 14â†’ 15â†’ 16â†’## Workflow Type 17â†’ 18â†’**Type**: feature 19â†’ 20â†’**Rationale**: This is a foundational feature addition that introduces new capabilities (internationalization and RTL support) to the application. It requires new infrastructure, configuration, translation files, and UI components for language switching, making it a feature workflow rather than a refactor or investigation. 21â†’ 22â†’## Task Scope 23â†’ 24â†’### Services Involved 25â†’- **frontend** (primary) - React/TypeScript application requiring i18n setup, RTL styling, and language switching UI 26â†’ 27â†’### This Task Will: 28â†’- [ properties 31â†’- [ ] Build language switcher component in the UI 32â†’- [ ] Extract hardcoded strings to translation keys 33â†’- [ ] Set up direction (LTR/RTL) detection and application 34â†’- [ ] Ensure Material-UI components support RTL properly 35â†’- [ ] Add language persistence to localStorage 36â†’- [ ] Create developer documentation for adding new translations 37â†’ 38â†’### Out of Emotion (CSS-in-JS) 55â†’- UI Library: Material-UI (@mui/material) 56â†’- i18n: i18next (already installed) 57â†’ 58â†’**Key Dependencies (Pre-installed):** 59â†’- `i18next` - Core 64â†’ 65â†’**How to Run:** 66â†’```bash 67â†’cd frontend 68â†’npm run dev 69â†’``` 70â†’ 71â†’**Port:** 3000 72â†’ 73â†’## Files to Modify 74â†’ 75â†’| File | Service | What to Change | 76â†’|------|---------|---------------| 77â†’| `frontend/src/main.tsx` or `frontend/src/App.tsx` | frontend | Wrap app with I18nextProvider and initialize i18n | 78â†’| `frontend/src/i18n/config.ts` | `frontend/src/i18n/locales/he/common.json` | frontend | Create Hebrew translation file (new file) | 81â†’| `frontend/src/theme/theme.ts` | frontend | Add direction property to theme based on language | 82â†’| `frontend/src/components/LanguageSwitcher.tsx` | frontend | Create language switcher component (new file) | 83â†’| `frontend/src/styles/rtl.css` | frontend | Create RTL-specific style overrides (new file) | 84â†’| `frontend/vite.config.ts` | frontend | Ensure i18next resources are bundled correctly | 85â†’ 86â†’## Files to Reference 87â†’ 88â†’These files show patterns to follow: 89â†’ 90â†’| File | Pattern to Copy | 91â†’|------|----------------| 92â†’| `frontend/src/App.tsx` | Root component structure, provider wrapping pattern | 93â†’| `frontend/src/theme/theme.ts` | Material-UI theme configuration pattern | 94â†’| `frontend/package.json` | Existing dependencies (i18next already installed) | 95â†’ 96â†’## Patterns to Follow 97â†’ 98â†’### 1. i18next Configuration Pattern 99â†’ 100â†’Create `frontend/src/i18n/config.ts`: 101â†’ 102â†’```typescript 103â†’import i18n from 'i18next'; 104â†’import { initReactI18next } from 'react-i18next'; 105â†’import LanguageDetector from 'i18next-browser-languagedetector'; 106â†’import enCommon from './locales/en/common.json'; 107â†’import heCommon from './locales/he/common.json'; 108â†’ 109â†’i18n 110â†’ .use(LanguageDetector) 111â†’ .use(initReactI18next) 112â†’ .init({ 113â†’ resources: { 114â†’ en: { common: enCommon }, 115â†’ he: { common: heCommon } 116â†’ }, 117â†’ fallbackLng: 'en', 118â†’ defaultNS: 'common', 119â†’ interpolation: { 120â†’ escapeValue: false // React already escapes 121â†’ }, 122â†’ detection: { 123â†’ order: ['localStorage', 'navigator'], 124â†’ caches: ['localStorage'] 125â†’ } 126â†’ }); 127â†’ 128â†’export default i18n; 129â†’``` 130â†’ 131â†’**Key Points:** 132â†’- Use LanguageDetector for automatic language selection 133â†’- Fallback to English if language not supported 134â†’- Cache language preference in localStorage 135â†’- Use namespaces (common) for organization 136â†’ 137â†’### 2. Material-UI RTL Theme Pattern 138â†’ 139â†’Update `frontend/src/theme/theme.ts`: 140â†’ 141â†’```typescript 142â†’import { createTheme, ThemeOptions } from '@mui/material/styles'; 143â†’import { prefixer } from 'stylis'; 144â†’import rtlPlugin from 'stylis-plugin-rtl'; 145â†’ 146â†’export const createAppTheme = (direction: 'ltr' | 'rtl') => { 147â†’ const themeOptions: ThemeOptions = { 148â†’ direction, 149â†’ // ... existing theme configuration 150â†’ }; 151â†’ 152â†’ return createTheme(themeOptions); 153â†’}; 154â†’``` 155â†’ 156â†’**Key Points:** 157â†’- Direction should be dynamically set based on current language 158â†’- Material-UI supports RTL through direction property 159â†’- May need stylis-plugin-rtl for Emotion (check if needed) 160â†’ 161â†’### 3. Translation Hook Pattern 162â†’ 163â†’```typescript 164â†’import { useTranslation } from 'react-i18next'; 165â†’ 166â†’function MyComponent() { 167â†’ const { t, i18n } = useTranslation('common'); 168â†’ 169â†’ return ( 170â†’

{t('welcome.title')}

172â†’ 175â†’

CSS Logical Properties Pattern 186â†’ 187â†’Use logical properties instead of directional properties: 188â†’ 189â†’```css 190â†’/* âŒ Don't use directional properties */ 191â†’.card { 192â†’ margin-left: 16px; 193â†’ text-align: left; 194â†’ padding-right: 8px; 195â†’} 196â†’ 197â†’/* âœ… Use logical properties */ 198â†’.card { 199â†’ margin-inline-start: 16px; 200â†’ text-align: start; 201â†’ padding-inline-end: 8px; 202â†’} 203â†’``` 204â†’ 205â†’**Key Points:** 206â†’- `margin-inline-start` instead of `margin-left` 207â†’- `padding-inline-end` instead of `padding-right` 208â†’- `text-align: start` instead of `text-align: left` 209â†’- `border-inline-start` instead of `border-left` 210â†’ 211â†’## Requirements 212â†’ 213â†’### Functional Requirements 214â†’ 215â†’1. **i18n Configuration** 216â†’ -     26â†’- frontend: React + TypeScript + Vite + Material-UI + Emotion
    27â†’  Role: Complete i18n migration for all UI components and pages
    28â†’
    29â†’Parallelism Analysis:
    30â†’- Max parallel phases: 1
    31â†’- Recommended workers: 1
    32â†’- Parallel groups: None (sequential execution required - phases depend on each other)
    33â†’- Phase 3 subtasks could be parallelized within the phase
    34â†’
    35â†’Key Findings from Investigation:
    36â†’âœ… i18next fully configured with language detection (localStorage â†’ navigator â†’ fallback to English)
    37â†’âœ… Translation files complete: en.json and he.json with 190+ keys
    38â†’âœ… LanguageToggle component exists and integrated in Header
    39â†’âœ… useLanguage hook provides language switching and RTL detection
    40â†’âœ… ThemeContext integrates dynamic direction into Material-UI theme
    41â†’âœ… rtl.css with Hebrew font, layout fixes, and flip-rtl class
    42â†’
    43â†’âŒ 24+ components still have hardcoded strings (not using t() function)
    44â†’âŒ Many components use directional CSS (marginLeft/Right) instead of logical properties
    45â†’âŒ Header has hardcoded notification text and menu items
    46â†’âŒ Pages (Dashboard, Projects, etc.) have ~40 hardcoded strings each
    47â†’âŒ Icons not marked with flip-rtl class for RTL directional flipping
    48â†’âŒ Comprehensive RTL layout testing not performed
    49â†’
    50â†’Existing Components Using i18n (Reference Patterns):
    51â†’- main.tsx (imports i18n config)
    52â†’- ThemeContext.tsx (integrates direction)
    53â†’- LanguageToggle.tsx (language switcher)
    54â†’- useLanguage.ts (custom hook)
    55â†’- Sidebar.tsx (partial usage)
    56â†’- DataTable.tsx (uses translations) â† Use as reference pattern
    57â†’
    58â†’Components Needing Migration (Priority Order):
    59â†’1. Core UI Components (Button, TextField, Select, Card, Modal, EmptyState, StatusBadge, Breadcrumbs, ProgressBar, Tabs)
    60â†’2. Layout Components (Header, Sidebar, Layout)
    61â†’3. Page Components (Dashboard, Projects, Equipment, Materials, Meetings, Approvals, Areas, Contacts, Inspections, RFIs, Login, AuditLog)
    62â†’4. CSS Refactoring (Replace marginLeft/Right with marginInlineStart/End)
    63â†’5. Icon Flipping (Add flip-rtl class to arrows/chevrons)
    64â†’
    65â†’Translation File Coverage:
    66â†’- common.* (38 keys): login, logout, save, cancel, delete, edit, add, search, filter, etc.
    67â†’- nav.* (11 keys): dashboard, projects, equipment, materials, meetings, approvals, areas, contacts, inspections, rfis, auditLog
    68â†’- dashboard.* (7 keys): title, welcome, overview, statistics, recentActivity, activeProjects, pendingApprovals, upcomingMeetings
    69â†’- projects.* (13 keys): title, createProject, projectName, projectCode, startDate, endDate, address, city, contractor, budget, progress, details, overview
    70â†’- equipment.* (9 keys): title, addEquipment, equipmentName, manufacturer, model, serialNumber, location, quantity, condition, documents
    71â†’- materials.* (10 keys): title, addMaterial, materialName, supplier, quantity, unit, unitPrice, totalPrice, deliveryDate, stockLevel
    72â†’- meetings.* (10 keys): title, scheduleMeeting, meetingTitle, meetingType, date, time, duration, location, attendees, agenda, minutes
    73â†’- approvals.* (12 keys): title, pending, approved, rejected, requestApproval, approvalType, requestedBy, requestDate, approver, comments, approve, reject
    74â†’- areas.* (6 keys): title, addArea, areaName, areaType, floor, size, assignedTo
    75â†’- contacts.* (7 keys): title, addContact, fullName, email, phone, company, role, department
    76â†’- inspections.* (10 keys): title, createInspection, inspectionType, inspector, scheduledDate, completedDate, findings, recommendations, passed, failed, checklist
    77â†’- rfis.* (14 keys): title, createRFI, rfiNumber, subject, question, response, to, cc, dueDate, open, closed, answered, waiting
    78â†’- audit.* (6 keys): title, action, user, timestamp, entity, changes
    79â†’- login.* (7 keys): title, email, password, rememberMe, forgotPassword, signIn, welcome
    80â†’
    81â†’TOTAL: 190+ translation keys covering all UI strings
    82â†’
    83â†’CSS Logical Properties Guide:
    84â†’- âŒ marginLeft â†’ âœ… marginInlineStart
    85â†’- âŒ marginRight â†’ âœ… marginInlineEnd
    86â†’- âŒ paddingLeft â†’ âœ… paddingInlineStart
    87â†’- âŒ paddingRight â†’ âœ… paddingInlineEnd
    88â†’- âŒ text-align: left â†’ âœ… text-align: start
    89â†’- âŒ text-align: right â†’ âœ… text-align: end
    90â†’- âŒ borderLeft â†’ âœ… borderInlineStart
    91â†’- âŒ borderRight â†’ âœ… borderInlineEnd
    92â†’- âŒ left: 0 â†’ âœ… insetInlineStart: 0
    93â†’- âŒ right: 0 â†’ âœ… insetInlineEnd: 0
    94â†’
    95â†’MUI sx prop examples:
    96â†’- âŒ sx={{ ml: 2 }} â†’ âœ… sx={{ marginInlineStart: 2 }}
    97â†’- âŒ sx={{ pr: 1 }} â†’ âœ… sx={{ paddingInlineEnd: 1 }}
    98â†’
    99â†’Verification Strategy:
   100â†’- Risk Level: medium
   101â†’- Test Types Required: integration, e2e
   102â†’- Browser Testing: Manual visual inspection in both LTR (English) and RTL (Hebrew) modes
   103â†’- Console Checks: Verify no i18next warnings for missing translation keys
   104â†’- Regression Testing: Run existing test suite (npm test) to ensure no breakage
   105â†’- Visual QA: Compare LTR and RTL layouts for all pages
   106â†’
   107â†’Acceptance Criteria:
   108â†’âœ“ All 24+ components converted from hardcoded strings to i18n
   109â†’âœ“ CSS-in-JS uses logical properties (no marginLeft/Right)
   110â†’âœ“ All pages tested in Hebrew RTL mode with no layout issues
   111â†’âœ“ Language persistence works (localStorage + detection)
   112â†’âœ“ No missing translation key warnings in console
   113â†’âœ“ Existing tests pass (no regressions)
   114â†’

entries.content:
Perfect! Let me create a summary of the completed work:

## âœ… Subtask 3-2 Completion Summary

I have successfully completed **subtask-3-2**: Migrating ProjectsPage and ProjectDetailPage to use projects.* translations.

### Changes Made:

#### **1. Translation Files Updated**
- **en.json**: Added 30+ new translation keys to the `projects` namespace and 3 keys to `common` namespace
  - `projects.totalProjects`, `active`, `onHold`, `completed`
  - `projects.noProjectsFound`, `noProjectsMessage`
  - `projects.editProject`, `viewTeam`, `exportReport`, `deleteProject`
  - `projects.codeCannotBeChanged`, `codeHint`
  - `projects.editProjectTitle`, `createNewProject`, `deleteConfirmation`
  - `projects.backToProjects`, `notFound`, `notFoundMessage`
  - `projects.equipmentCount`, `materialsCount`, `meetingsCount`, `pendingApprovals`
  - `projects.projectProgress`, `overallCompletion`, `completedTasks`, `inProgress`, `pending`
  - `projects.quickStats`, `teamMembersDescription`, `team`
  - `common.gridView`, `listView`, `saveChanges`

- **he.json**: Added corresponding Hebrew translations for all new keys

#### **2. ProjectsPage.tsx Migrated**
- âœ… Imported `useTranslation` hook
- âœ… Replaced 40+ hardcoded English strings with i18n translation calls:
  - KPI card titles (Total Projects, Active, On Hold, Completed)
  - Grid/List view toggle buttons
  - Project status filter tabs
  - Empty state messages
  - Context menu items (Edit, View Team, Export, Delete)
  - Create/Edit/Delete modal titles and labels
  - All form field labels (Project Name, Code, Description, Address, Start/End Date)
  - Delete confirmation dialog with dynamic project name

#### **3. ProjectDetailPage.tsx Migrated**
- âœ… Imported `useTranslation` hook
- âœ… Refactored tab configuration to use translation keys
- âœ… Replaced 30+ hardcoded strings with i18n calls:
  - Back to Projects button
  - Project not found messages
  - Edit Project button
  - All 9 tab labels (Overview, Equipment, Materials, Meetings, etc.)
  - KPI card titles
  - Project progress section (Progress, Overall Completion, Completed Tasks, In Progress, Pending)
  - Quick Stats card with metrics labels
  - Team section title and description
  - View Team button

### Quality Checks:
âœ… JSON syntax validated for both translation files
âœ… All translation keys follow established naming patterns
âœ… useTranslation hooks properly imported and used
âœ… Translation keys properly nested (projects.*, equipment.*, materials.*, etc.)
âœ… Changes committed to git: commit `c1c1c49`

### Verification Points:
When the application is started with the updated code:
- [ ] Browse to http://localhost:3000/projects
- [ ] Verify all project list page text displays in selected language
- [ ] Click on a project to view project detail page
- [ ] Switch language to Hebrew to verify RTL layout with Hebrew text
- [ ] Verify form labels, modal titles, and menu items are translated

All hardcoded strings have been successfully converted to use i18n translation keys following the established pattern. The implementation is complete and ready for testing.
I'll help you migrate the EquipmentPage and MaterialsPage to use the equipment.* and materials.* translations. Let me start by verifying my current directory and then examining the relevant files.
Now let me read the spec and implementation plan to understand the context:

1â†’# RTL and Internationalization - Complete Implementation 2â†’ 3â†’## Overview 4â†’# [EPIC] RTL and Internationalization 5â†’ 6â†’**Linear Issue:** [BUI-43](https://linear.app/builder-project/issue/BUI-43/epic-rtl-and-internationalization) 7â†’**Priority:** High 8â†’**Status:** Backlog 9â†’ 10â†’ 11â†’## Description 12â†’ 13â†’Hebrew RTL support and bilingual infrastructure. Priority: P1. Points: 8 14â†’ 15â†’ 16â†’## Workflow Type 17â†’ 18â†’**Type**: feature 19â†’ 20â†’**Rationale**: This is a foundational feature addition that introduces new capabilities (internationalization and RTL support) to the application. It requires new infrastructure, configuration, translation files, and UI components for language switching, making it a feature workflow rather than a refactor or investigation. 21â†’ 22â†’## Task Scope 23â†’ 24â†’### Services Involved 25â†’- **frontend** (primary) - React/TypeScript application requiring i18n setup, RTL styling, and language switching UI 26â†’ 27â†’### This Task Will: 28â†’- [ ] Configure i18next with language detection and fallback mechanisms 29â†’- [ ] Create translation file structure for English and Hebrew 30â†’- [ ] Implement RTL-aware CSS architecture using logical properties 31â†’- [ ] Build language switcher component in the UI 32â†’- [ ] Extract hardcoded strings to translation keys 33â†’- [ ] Set up direction (LTR/RTL) detection and application 34â†’- [ ] Ensure Material-UI components support RTL properly 35â†’- [ ] Add language persistence to localStorage 36â†’- [ ] Create developer documentation for adding new translations 37â†’ 38â†’### Out of Scope: 39â†’- Translation of backend API responses or error messages 40â†’- Complete translation of all UI strings (will be incremental) 41â†’- Additional languages beyond English and Hebrew 42â†’- Automated translation or translation management platforms 43â†’- Currency or number format localization (future enhancement) 44â†’- Date format localization (dayjs already configured, but full integration deferred) 45â†’ 46â†’## Service Context 47â†’ 48â†’### frontend 49â†’ 50â†’**Tech Stack:** 51â†’- Language: TypeScript 52â†’- Framework: React 53â†’- Build Tool: Vite 54â†’- Styling: Emotion (CSS-in-JS) 55â†’- UI Library: Material-UI (@mui/material) 56â†’- i18n: i18next (already installed) 57â†’ 58â†’**Key Dependencies (Pre-installed):** 59â†’- `i18next` - Core internationalization framework 60â†’- `react-i18next` - React bindings for i18next 61â†’- `i18next-browser-languagedetector` - Automatic language detection 62â†’ 63â†’**Entry Point:** `src/App.tsx` 64â†’ 65â†’**How to Run:** 66â†’```bash 67â†’cd frontend 68â†’npm run dev 69â†’``` 70â†’ 71â†’**Port:** 3000 72â†’ 73â†’## Files to Modify 74â†’ 75â†’| File | Service | What to Change | 76â†’|------|---------|---------------| 77â†’| `frontend/src/main.tsx` or `frontend/src/App.tsx` | frontend | Wrap app with I18nextProvider and initialize i18n | 78â†’| `frontend/src/i18n/config.ts` | frontend | Create i18next configuration with language detection and resources | 79â†’| `frontend/src/i18n/locales/en/common.json` | frontend | Create English translation file (new file) | 80â†’| `frontend/src/i18n/locales/he/common.json` | frontend | Create Hebrew translation file (new file) | 81â†’| `frontend/src/theme/theme.ts` | frontend | Add direction property to theme based on language | 82â†’| `frontend/src/components/LanguageSwitcher.tsx` | frontend | Create language switcher component (new file) | 83â†’| `frontend/src/styles/rtl.css` | frontend | Create RTL-specific style overrides (new file) | 84â†’| `frontend/vite.config.ts` | frontend | Ensure i18next resources are bundled correctly | 85â†’ 86â†’## Files to Reference 87â†’ 88â†’These files show patterns to follow: 89â†’ 90â†’| File | Pattern to Copy | 91â†’|------|----------------| 92â†’| `frontend/src/App.tsx` | Root component structure, provider wrapping pattern | 93â†’| `frontend/src/theme/theme.ts` | Material-UI theme configuration pattern | 94â†’| `frontend/package.json` | Existing dependencies (i18next already installed) | 95â†’ 96â†’## Patterns to Follow 97â†’ 98â†’### 1. i18next Configuration Pattern 99â†’ 100â†’Create `frontend/src/i18n/config.ts`: 101â†’ 102â†’```typescript 103â†’import i18n from 'i18next'; 104â†’import { initReactI18next } from 'react-i18next'; 105â†’import LanguageDetector from 'i18next-browser-languagedetector'; 106â†’import enCommon from './locales/en/common.json'; 107â†’import heCommon from './locales/he/common.json'; 108â†’ 109â†’i18n 110â†’ .use(LanguageDetector) 111â†’ .use(initReactI18next) 112â†’ .init({ 113â†’ resources: { 114â†’ en: { common: enCommon }, 115â†’ he: { common: heCommon } 116â†’ }, 117â†’ fallbackLng: 'en', 118â†’ defaultNS: 'common', 119â†’ interpolation: { 120â†’ escapeValue: false // React already escapes 121â†’ }, 122â†’ detection: { 123â†’ order: ['localStorage', 'navigator'], 124â†’ caches: ['localStorage'] 125â†’ } 126â†’ }); 127â†’ 128â†’export default i18n; 129â†’``` 130â†’ 131â†’**Key Points:** 132â†’- Use LanguageDetector for automatic language selection 133â†’- Fallback to English if language not supported 134â†’- Cache language preference in localStorage 135â†’- Use namespaces (common) for organization 136â†’ 137â†’### 2. Material-UI RTL Theme Pattern 138â†’ 139â†’Update `frontend/src/theme/theme.ts`: 140â†’ 141â†’```typescript 142â†’import { createTheme, ThemeOptions } from '@mui/material/styles'; 143â†’import { prefixer } from 'stylis'; 144â†’import rtlPlugin from 'stylis-plugin-rtl'; 145â†’ 146â†’export const createAppTheme = (direction: 'ltr' | 'rtl') => { 147â†’ const themeOptions: ThemeOptions = { 148â†’ direction, 149â†’ // ... existing theme configuration 150â†’ }; 151â†’ 152â†’ return createTheme(themeOptions); 153â†’}; 154â†’``` 155â†’ 156â†’**Key Points:** 157â†’- Direction should be dynamically set based on current language 158â†’- Material-UI supports RTL through direction property 159â†’- May need stylis-plugin-rtl for Emotion (check if needed) 160â†’ 161â†’### 3. Translation Hook Pattern 162â†’ 163â†’```typescript 164â†’import { useTranslation } from 'react-i18next'; 165â†’ 166â†’function MyComponent() { 167â†’ const { t, i18n } = useTranslation('common'); 168â†’ 169â†’ return ( 170â†’
171â†’

{t('welcome.title')}

172â†’ 175â†’
176â†’ ); 177â†’} 178â†’``` 179â†’ 180â†’**Key Points:** 181â†’- Use `useTranslation` hook to access translations 182â†’- Call `t()` function with translation key 183â†’- Use `i18n.changeLanguage()` to switch languages 184â†’ 185â†’### 4. CSS Logical Properties Pattern 186â†’ 187â†’Use logical properties instead of directional properties: 188â†’ 189â†’```css 190â†’/* âŒ Don't use directional properties */ 191â†’.card { 192â†’ margin-left: 16px; 193â†’ text-align: left; 194â†’ padding-right: 8px; 195â†’} 196â†’ 197â†’/* âœ… Use logical properties */ 198â†’.card { 199â†’ margin-inline-start: 16px; 200â†’ text-align: start; 201â†’ padding-inline-end: 8px; 202â†’} 203â†’``` 204â†’ 205â†’**Key Points:** 206â†’- `margin-inline-start` instead of `margin-left` 207â†’- `padding-inline-end` instead of `padding-right` 208â†’- `text-align: start` instead of `text-align: left` 209â†’- `border-inline-start` instead of `border-left` 210â†’ 211â†’## Requirements 212â†’ 213â†’### Functional Requirements 214â†’ 215â†’1. **i18n Configuration** 216â†’ - Description: Set up i18next with language detection, fallback, and resource loading 217â†’ - Acceptance: 218â†’ - Application initializes with detected browser language (English or Hebrew) 219â†’ - Falls back to English if browser language is not supported 220â†’ - Language preference persists across page reloads via localStorage 221â†’ 222â†’2. **Translation Files** 223â†’ - Description: Create structured JSON translation files for English and Hebrew 224â†’ - Acceptance: 225â†’ - `frontend/src/i18n/locales/en/common.json` contains English translations 226â†’ - `frontend/src/i18n/locales/he/common.json` contains Hebrew translations 227â†’ - Translation keys follow nested structure (e.g., `navigation.home`, `forms.submit`) 228â†’ - At least 20 core UI strings are translated 229â†’ 230â†’3. **RTL Layout Support** 231â†’ - Description: Implement CSS architecture that automatically adjusts for RTL languages 232â†’ - Acceptance: 233â†’ - When Hebrew is selected, entire UI flips to RTL orientation 234â†’ - Navigation menus, sidebars, and card layouts mirror correctly 235â†’ - Icons and buttons align to appropriate side 236â†’ - Text direction changes to RTL for Hebrew content 237â†’ 238â†’4. **Language Switcher Component** 239â†’ - Description: Build UI component allowing users to switch between languages 240â†’ - Acceptance: 241â†’ - Language switcher visible in app header/navigation 242â†’ - Shows current language (e.g., "EN" or "×¢×‘") 243â†’ - Clicking switcher changes language and updates UI immediately 244â†’ - Language change reflected in document direction and translations 245â†’ 246â†’5. **Material-UI RTL Integration** 247â†’ - Description: Configure Material-UI theme to support RTL direction 248â†’ - Acceptance: 249â†’ - MUI components (buttons, inputs, dialogs) respect RTL direction 250â†’ - Theme direction updates when language changes 251â†’ - No visual glitches or misaligned MUI components in RTL mode 252â†’ 253â†’6. **Developer Documentation** 254â†’ -
